name: bounce
posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: bounce
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to (cause to) move up or away after hitting a surface

example.eg: The ball bounced off the goalpost and into the net.
example.egtrans: 球击中门柱弹进了球网。

example.eg: Her bag bounced (= moved up and down) against her side as she walked.
example.egtrans: 她走起路来身侧的挎包一颠一颠的。

example.eg: The children had broken the bed by bouncing (= jumping up and down) on it.
example.egtrans: 孩子们老在床上蹦，把床蹦坏了。

example.eg: He bounced the baby (= lifted it up and down) on his knee.
example.egtrans: 他把婴儿放在膝上颠着玩。

example.eg: Television pictures from all over the world are bounced off satellites (= are sent to and returned from them).
example.egtrans: 世界各地的电视画面都通过卫星转播。

trans_examp.trans_en: to move in an energetic and enthusiastic manner

example.egtrans: 汤姆蹦蹦跳跳地进来了，脸上笑开了花。

dsense.name: bounce
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to (cause a cheque to) not be paid or accepted by a bank because there is no money in the account
trans_examp.trans_cn: （因账上存款不敷）（使支票）拒付，退回

example.eg: I had to pay a penalty fee when my cheque bounced.
example.egtrans: 由于支票被银行拒付，我不得不付一笔罚金。

example.eg: To my horror the bank bounced the cheque.
example.egtrans: 令我震惊的是，银行拒付了支票。

dsense.name: bounce
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: If an email that you send bounces or is bounced, it comes back to you because the address is wrong or there is a computer problem.
trans_examp.trans_cn: （电子邮件）被退回，发送（电子邮件）失败

name: bounce
posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: bounce
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the act of bouncing, or the quality that makes something able to bounce

example.eg: In tennis you have to hit the ball before its second bounce.
example.egtrans: 打网球时必须在球第二次落地之前出手击打。

example.eg: This shampoo will give your hair bounce (= make it look attractively thick) and shine.
example.egtrans: 这种洗发精会使头发富有弹性和光泽。

dsense.name: bounce
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an improvement or change to a higher level, for example in how popular a politician or party is

example.eg: His speech to the convention may have given him a bounce.
example.egtrans: 他在大会做的演讲可能已让他一战成名。

example.eg: The city has seen a bounce in homicide.
example.egtrans: 这座城市杀人凶案数反弹了。
